document.docAuthor: Pereira, Luis A., Ituarte, Cristián & Tassara, Mónica P.
document.masterDocTitle: The types of Chilopoda and Diplopoda (Myriapoda) housed at the Museo de La Plata, Argentina

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The types of Chilopoda and Diplopoda (Myriapoda) housed at the Museo de La Plata, Argentina

subSubSection.paragraph:
Schubart 1954 b
. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología . 17 ( 154 ): 312 . Holotype , ɗ, MLP 590 (gonopods on a slide; legs 7 and 10 on a second slide; legs 1, 2 , 3, 5 , 8, 10 , 15, 20 , 25 and 30 on a third slide; rest of the body not presently housed at MLP ), ARGENTINA : Buenos Aires, Mar del Plata,
XII­ 1939
, M. Birabén coll.

paragraph.bibRef:
1954
c.
Notas Mus . La Plata, Zoología
17
(
155
): 352 . Holotype , ɗ, MLP 541 (whole specimen on a slide), ARGENTINA : Buenos Aires, Ensenada, Punta Lara,
21 ­XI­ 1934
, J. A. Rosas Costa coll. Paratype , ɗ, MLP 524 (gonopods and 7 th pair of legs on a slide; rest of the body not presently housed at MLP ), same data as holotype except
X­ 1938
, M. Birabén coll.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks: Paratype status not established in original description, but handwritten by Schubart on slide label.

Schubart 1954 b. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología 17 ( 154 ): 322 . Type , ɗ, MLP 598 (legs 1, 2 , 3, 5 , 10, 15 , 20, 25 , 29 and 30 on a slide; gonopods on a second slide; rest of the body in alcohol), CHILE : Quebrada Macul, Santiago de Chile ,
IX­ 1945
, Kuschel coll. Paratypes ( 7 ): 2 ΨΨ, 1 ɗ, 4 immatures ( 3 ΨΨ, 1 ɗ), MLP 598 (ventral plate and 6 legs of a Ψ paratype on a slide not labeled as paratype but cited as such in the original description); remaining paratype materials in alcohol, same data as type .

Remarks : In the original description (p. 325 ) the author reports as type locality: ‘ CHILE : Quebrada Macul, barrio Santiago de Chile , en el distrito de Ñuñca’ (misspelling for Ñuñoa?). According to the original description, 2 paratypes ( 1 Ψ and 1 ɗ) were deposited in the author’s collection.

Schubart 1954 a. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología 17 ( 150 ): 126 . Type , ɗ, MLP 557 (legs 1, 2 , 3, 5 , 10, 15 , 20, 25 and 30 on a slide; gonopods on a second slide; rest of the body not presently housed at MLP ), ARGENTINA : Córdoba, Alta Gracia,
I­ 1939
, Bruch coll. Paratypes ( 8 ): 4 ΨΨ, 4 ɗɗ, MLP 557 (in alcohol), same data as type .

Remarks: The
8 specimens
MLP 557 from Alta Gracia, Córdoba were labeled as paratypes by the author but this status was not established in the original description; 3 ΨΨ and 3 ɗɗ from the original sample were deposited in Schubart’s collection.

Schubart 1954 b. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología . 17 ( 154 ): 319 . Type , ɗ, MLP 568 (legs 1, 2 , 3, 4 and right gonopod on a slide; rest of the body not presently housed at MLP ), CHILE : Quebrada Macul, cerca de Santiago de Chile ,
IX­ 1945
, Kuschel coll.
Remarks: Left gonopod on a slide housed at MZUSP . In the original description, Schubart reported 1 Ψ from the type locality, not presently housed at MLP .

Schubart 1954 a. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología 17 ( 150 ): 136 . Type , ɗ, MLP 582 (legs 1, 2 , 5, 10 , 15, 20 , 25 and 30 on a slide; gonopods on a second slide; rest of the body in alcohol), ARGENTINA : Misiones, P. Iguazú, 14 /
15 ­I­ 1944
, Williner coll. Paratypes ( 4 ): 1 Ψ, 1 ɗ,
2 juveniles
( 1 Ψ, 1 ɗ), MLP 559 (in alcohol), same data as type except 10 /
13 ­XI­ 1944
, coll.?

Remarks: The
4 specimens
MLP 559 from Iguazú, Misiones, were labeled as paratypes by the author but this status was not established in the original description; 1 ɗ with the same data as the paratypes was deposited in Schubart’s collection.

Schubart 1954 b. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología 17 ( 154 ): 310 . Holotype , ɗ, MLP 599 (legs 1, 2 , 3, 5 , 7, 10 , 15, 20 , 25 and 30 on a slide; gonopods on a second slide; rest of the body not presently housed at MLP ), ARGENTINA : Neuquén, Lago Nahuel Huapi, Isla Victoria,
XII­ 1943
, Havrilenko coll.

Remarks: The specimens that Schubart mentions in his original description are 1 ɗ and 3 ΨΨ (all with same number and data as holotype ). At the MLP collection, besides the holotype ɗ, there is a vial with a label handwritten by Schubart that reads: ‘ 2 ΨΨ – Allotype’ containing two ΨΨ specimens (none of them individualized as allotype) and also a slide with legs 3, 7 , 15 and 30 of a Ψ that presumably correspond to the allotype, but not labeled as so. According to Schubart the remaining Ψ specimen was deposited in his personal collection.

Schubart 1954 a. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología 17 ( 150 ): 117 . Holotype , ɗ, MLP 597 (legs 1, 2 , 3, 5 , 10, 20 , 25 and 30 on a slide; gonopods on a second slide; rest of the body in alcohol), ARGENTINA : Misiones, Iguazú, 10 /
13 ­XI. 1944
, coll?

Remarks: The sample MLP 597 is labeled as ‘
Camptomorpha missionensis’
, however in the original description the species is named: ‘
Camptomorpha missiones’
, even if under the subtitle ‘Observaciones’ (p. 119 ) the species is referred to as
C. missionensis
. In the original description, the collecting date of holotype is lacking, but the label of MLP 597 indicates ‘ 10 /
13 ­XI­ 1944
’.

Schubart 1954 b. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología . 17 ( 154 ): 316 . Type , ɗ, MLP 554 (legs 1, 2 , 5, 10 , 15, 20 , 25 and 30 on a slide; gonopods on a second slide; rest of the body in alcohol), ARGENTINA : Neuquén, Lago Nahuel Huapi, Isla Victoria,
XII­ 1943
, Havrilenko coll.
Remarks: In the original description, Schubart reported a second ɗ specimen from the type locality without indication of type status, not presently housed at MLP .

Schubart 1954 a. Notas Mus. La Plata, Zoología 17 ( 150 ): 132 . Holotype , ɗ, MLP 558 (legs 1, 2 , 3, 5 , 10, 15 , 20, 25 and 30 on a slide labeled as ‘typus’; gonopods on a second slide labeled as ‘typus’; rest of the body in alcohol, labeled as ‘holotypus’), ARGEN­ TINA : Chaco, Pinedo,
8 ­XII­ 1939
, M. Birabén coll. (collector specified in the original description, but not in the corresponding label). Paratypes ( 3 ): 1 Ψ, 2 ɗɗ, MLP 558 (in alcohol, labeled as ‘Paratypus’), same data as the type .
Remarks: According to Schubart, 2 ɗɗ from sample MLP 558 were deposited in his personal collection.
